Coding up a visualization for the website page where my tutorials will be hosted
Aiming for a complex, emotion-evoking display of Bayesianism (prior, likelihood, and posterior)

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

library(tidyverse)
```

```{r generate data}
prior <- rnorm(n = 1000, mean = 0, sd = 1)
```

```{r plot normal distrib}
ggplot(data.frame(prior), aes(prior)) +
  geom_histogram(aes(y=after_stat(density)), binwidth=0.3, 
                 fill="skyblue", color="black") +
  geom_density(alpha=.2, fill="#FF6655") + 
  labs(title="Histogram of Random Numbers from a Normal Distribution",
  x="Value",
  y="Density") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(panel.grid.major = element_line(linetype = "dashed"))
```
